intro: Fagara dipetala var. hillebrandii, commonly known as the Hillebrand's fagara, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of Central America. It is characterized by its evergreen foliage, with dark green, glossy leaves that are typically ovate to elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters at the base of the leaves. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
